content:
Diagnosis:
Clear cell renal cell carcinoma, right kidney
T3aN0M0 (Stage III)
KIT mutation positive

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes

Current medications:
Amlodipine 5mg daily
Metformin 1g twice daily

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Recently diagnosed following investigation of incidental finding on routine ultrasound

CT abdomen/pelvis 15 March 2024 - 7.2cm mass right kidney upper pole with perinephric fat invasion
CT chest 18 March 2024 - No evidence of metastatic disease
Bone scan 20 March 2024 - Normal

Performance status 0

I reviewed [redacted name] today following recent diagnosis of locally advanced renal cell carcinoma. The staging investigations show no evidence of metastatic spread. The tumor is confined to the kidney but with evidence of local invasion into perinephric fat. Molecular testing has confirmed presence of KIT mutation.

On examination today, he is well with normal vital signs. Abdomen is soft and non-tender with no palpable masses. No peripheral edema.

I have discussed the case with our uro-oncology MDT. Given the locally advanced nature but absence of metastatic disease, we recommend proceeding with right radical nephrectomy. I have explained the procedure, recovery process and potential complications. [redacted name] understands and wishes to proceed.

Plan:
1. Referred to [redacted name] for surgical assessment
2. Pre-operative assessment to be arranged
3. Follow up in combined surgical-oncology clinic in 2 weeks with surgical date
